Alerts:

Alert you have lost x number of followers
Not gaining any new followers

- Influencer graph.

- Mark as leads in accounts
- Mark sentiment in accounts

- Explore making NOT's large in Adding a profile.

** Reporting center.

- More reporting functionality.
- Always compare these reports, email me the report every week.
- Alert in Dashboard, report is ready, PDF or Export to Excel

- HootSuite offers to email the PDf'ed reports.
- Do you want this report emailed.


- Publish bar should stay static, so that the user can publish from anywhere. (floating Nav bar)

- Google analytics integration
- How much traffic are you driving from product pages to website 

- Line colors do not export very well.
- Colors to be different (Tools compare/combine section) - Lighter on top

- Linkedin, G+, Google Analytics.
- Yelp

- YouTube as an account separately. (YouTube Followers and Fans)

- Mobile apps. (HootSuite) - not using HootSuite

- Choose URL Shortener (Choose from bit.ly, j.mp. ow.ly)

- Current pricing model - New model ($500 - 15 profiles)


- Explain grand-fathering to existing customers. Come up with a grand fathering scheme.
- People do not know about the Tools section. (Check what you want to compare and contrast...) right from within the profile.

- 

-- Be more invasive (Tweets are Negative or anything blowing up, send me email right away)
- Do more alerting - Emails, SMS, Notifications.
- Need to know (Need to know something is going)
- Set an Alert that this is a fire.
- Facebook Likes as a daily report.
- 5 top stats at the email.
- Summary emails.
- Setup a time when to be alerted, right away, once a day, once a week, once a month etc..

- Hootsuite, wants in terms of Engagement -
- Growl style notifications (When company accounts gets mentioned)
- Group profiles into clusters. Streams.

- Way too much money for Radian6.

Agencies care more about reporting than engagement.
Reporting center. customizable pieces PDF. Email the report to me at this specified time.

column6: The Wall needs to be revamped
column18:
This is also a much larger project, but lets revamp the Mentions screen in the system.

1. We will have a Unified Wall that can account for all media types.

- Tweets, Facebook updates, Blogs, Videos, Pictures, Updates from Linkedin, Google+
- These walls will have comments too.

- lets come up with specs and let's start designing this wall.

column6: Enhance Publishing Capabilities in Viralheat
column18:
Currently it is very basic. Lets add more features to publishing and make it more robust.

Below are high level specs, lets come up with a Mock and design it out.

- Not all the features have to go out in one shot, lets keep all these in mind while designing and we can slowly push out feature by feature.


Publishing Features:

1. Ability to Schedule the post to be sent at a later time.
- The user can schedule the tweet to be sent a specific time.
- The use can setup recurring tweet or updates (to be sent out on all network or certain networks)
- The system can suggest times to them to send the tweets out.

2. Ability to Preview the message.
- The user should be able to preview the message, as it is going to look once published on Twitter, Facebook and all support platforms.

3. Ability to attached links.
- The user should be able to attach links to the message that is published. 
- The URL should be shortened. Currently using bit.ly but later we can add more options or have our own URL Shortener.

4. User should be able to attach a location to the message published.
- User can attach a location to the tweet.


5. User should be able to attach or upload a picture to the message published..
- We should store these pictures on our end on Amazon etc or pass it directly yo Twitter / Facebook
- might need to store them if these tweets are scheduled to be sent out later.

6. (Advanced feature) Ability to syndicate content from RSS feeds.
- user should be able to attach their blog or RSS feed and as soon as a blog is published, it will go out on The pre-defined Twitter account.

column18: This code is currently functioning due to hacks that ensure that facebook callback code is executed or (if not) execute some alternative code instructing the user to logout on facebook.com (with a link that pops in a new window). I believe the problem here is that _facebook.html.erb is loading the facebook div and JS file which are somehow destroyed and reloaded on each facebox (when clicking "add account") This seems to break several aspects of the Facebook JS SDK and callbacks or subscribed events no longer function and therefore the user cannot Logout through our app on any successive clicks to "add account" without a full page refresh.

UserFacebookFanPage functions for Publishable concerns - Review the below functions
column9: 1.4 Sprint 6 (Half Sprint) - Some Features, Mostly QA
column18:
Most of the backed is zlib-ed these functions might not work. Lets review.

  # This model implements the "publishable" concern
  include Publishable   
  
  establish_connection :database_microblogs  

  #
  # This is required by the Publishable Concern
  #
  def _publish(user_id, message)    
    begin      
      ret = self.publish_facebook_location(message, user_id) 
    rescue Exception => e
      logger.info "ERROR: #{e.to_s}"
      case e.to_s
      when "OAuthException: Error validating application."
        # Invalidate this page
        self.is_invalid = 1
        self.save!
      else
        
      end
      # Throw other errors up the stack
      raise e
    end
    return ret
  end
  
  #
  # This is also required by the Publishable Concern
  #
  def _name
    # Get the fanpage name from the associated facebook_page record
    fanpage = FacebookFanpages.find(:first, :conditions => ['record_key = ?', record_key])                                                          
    raw_json = ActiveSupport::JSON.decode(fanpage.body)
    return raw_json["title"]
  end
  
  #
  # This is also required by the Publishable Concern
  #
  def _icon
    record = FacebookFanpages.return_facebook_record(record_key)        
    return record['profile_image']  
  end

Moving UserFacebookFanpages#get_fanpages to a background process
column18:
Will move UserFacebookFanpages#get_fanpages to a background process to reduce page load times when loading Accounts#list

As it is now, for every possible page a user has created with their Facebook account would add to the number of requests #get_fanpages would have to make to query the FB for data.

column18:
Here's a list of functionalities that would be cool. I might need to explain some of them:

* Breakdown of top influencer mentions across my brand v. competitors
* Breakdown of top influencer mentions across industry keywords & my brand
* Breakdown of this top influencer v. other industry influencers
* Geographies with the most influential users and the top topics in that geo
* Top 10 positive influencers
* Top 10 negative influencers
* Most retweeted post from my brand/handle
* Most responded to tweet/post from my brand/handle
* Most popular post person from my company (when seat management available)
* Business/Brand influencers v. Personal influencers (the difference between seeing that Huffington Post is an influencer in your industry versus an individual like @JohnSmith)
* Breakdown of: Topics v. Direct Mentions v. Retweets

column6: Twitter can be upgraded to use stream api instead of polling
column18:
Twitter does not register a retweet immediately upon returning a success message
        Handled by introducing a 1500ms delay before reloading the tweet.
        The proper way is to open a stream, wait for any updates, and display them in real-time on the page.

column6: Twitter & Facebook: Displaying backend twitter records using the new stream code will require code updates to work.
column18: Backend records can only currently be displayed, not interacted with. Interaction will require a few hours of coding time. There are also pieces of information about tweets that are missing in backend records such as â€œrewteet_countâ€.

column18:
1. Check to make sure Salesforce oAuth works and records can be exported to Salesforce.

Current features:

* Install sconnect_release to the salesforce account you wish to connect
* Initiate an OAuth 2.0 connection with the target Salesforce account
* Remove a connected salesforce account
* Send a Twitter mention to one of N linked Salesforce accounts

Check this integration out with Zendesk for more information.

https://support.zendesk.com/entries/348360-zendesk-for-salesforce-getting-started

column6: Add state-level location filter
column18:
"I wanted to filter down my searches to the state level.  My project this year is political forecasting at the state level using Twitter.  For example, to predict the outcome of the Florida primaries, I need to have the data broken down to account for just a single state.  Being able to filter Twitter data down to the state level will be an invaluable research and marketing tool alike."

Shawn Meacham
Twitter Researcher

column6: Engagement Functionality
column18:
h2. High level Requirements

# Can transmit a message to twitter/facebook from dashboard, even using multiple accounts. For each FB account the post can go to multiple locations (wall/fanpages)
# (NOT IN 1.4) can time tweet transmission in the future (date/time)
# from the raw feed you can retweet/reply (only on the same network), and can choose which accounts to retweet from


h2. Technical Requirements

h3. New Campaigns

# Dashboard -> Post to Facebook: Create a way to post to your own facebook wall or fanpage (text-only in 1.4) (with x accounts) 
Get fanpage/wall IDs (fb account id)
Publish to facebook location (fb account id, datetime(optional), message, wall/fanpage IDs) This could then be run for each fb account id
Model: Get user facebook accounts (returns a list of facebook account ids)
Get facebook fanpages for User (fb user id)
# Dashboard -> Tweet: Create a way to tweet something with X accounts. (can be posted in the future, same time by each account?)
Publish to Twitter (twitter account id, datetime(optional), message)
# (NOT IN 1.4) Dashboard -> Post Video: Create a way to post a video to Youtube with X accounts

h3. Engagement

# Profile Dashboard -> Facebook: Create a way to publicly comment on a mention.
# Profile Dashboard -> Twitter: Create a way to retweet a mention (from X accounts), or by tweeting something with @author (with X accounts), or by replying (with a single account), or even by replying all.

h3. Other

# Engagement functionality should be a new controller (engagement or maybe publishing)

h2. Additional Requirements

# Keep a history of everything published through Viralheat
# (NOT IN 1.4) Scheduling for future transmission of messsages
# (NOT IN 1.4) Profile Dashboard -> Video: Create a way to comment on a Youtube Video (with 1 account per comment), (Requires Connecting Facebook as an External Account)(can be posted in the future?)
# UI: Profile Dashboard -> Create a way of prompting the user to connect the appropriate account in order to engage in the discussion
# Text only for now, rich media to come later. Avoid the assumption that the message is text.

h2. Additional Notes

# Users can participate in a thread discussion, but our app has no way of viewing a thread!
# Look into cotweet
# Note: in 1.4, a single user behaves as multitenant

column18:
Collection Feedback from users:

I would mostly need something to search through LinkedIn  conversations, so Groups and forums (maybe LinkedIn questions too) for specific keywords, preferably even those in which I'm not a member yet. Also, I'd like to track and analyze my own groups' and company page's acitivity, e.g. a tool providing an industrial sorting of page visitors or group members would be very useful. And of course, the usual things like diagrams how the number of visitors has been changing, how many people have been directed to the webpage from LinkedIn sources, main influencers in given topic, etc.
